intro: Phacelia indecora, commonly known as the showy phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, often in areas with well-drained soil. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to attract pollinators. Phacelia indecora is also used in restoration projects due to its ecological benefits and aesthetic appeal.
